content: Introduced in 2016, the SS Scheme provides a quarterly cash supplement to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have less in retirement.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Greater assurance for seniors

Quarterly cash supplement
metadata.content: Introduced in 2016, the SS Scheme provides a quarterly cash supplement to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have less in retirement.

content: The quarterly cash supplements of the SS Scheme were raised in 2021 to strengthen support for seniors with lesser means. This enhancement adds to the retirement income of close to 250,000 Singapore Citizens aged 65 and above.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Greater assurance for seniors

Adding to retirement income
metadata.content: The quarterly cash supplements of the SS Scheme were raised in 2021 to strengthen support for seniors with lesser means. This enhancement adds to the retirement income of close to 250,000 Singapore Citizens aged 65 and above.

content: There’s no need for you to apply for the SS Scheme. If you’re a Singapore Citizen aged 65 and above, you’ll automatically qualify whenever you meet all of the following criteria:

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Who’s eligible for the Silver Support Scheme?

Overview
metadata.content: There’s no need for you to apply for the SS Scheme. If you’re a Singapore Citizen aged 65 and above, you’ll automatically qualify whenever you meet all of the following criteria:

content: The total CPF contributions you made by age 55 is up to $140,000. Total CPF contributions refer to the total sum in your Ordinary and Special accounts, including amounts withdrawn for housing, education, and investment. If you’re self-employed, your average annual net trade income is up to $27,600 when you were between the ages of 45 and 54.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Who’s eligible for the Silver Support Scheme?

Low lifetime wages
metadata.content: The total CPF contributions you made by age 55 is up to $140,000. Total CPF contributions refer to the total sum in your Ordinary and Special accounts, including amounts withdrawn for housing, education, and investment. If you’re self-employed, your average annual net trade income is up to $27,600 when you were between the ages of 45 and 54.

content: You live in a 1- to 5-room HDB flat. You or your spouse do not own a 5-room or larger HDB flat, private property or multiple properties.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Who’s eligible for the Silver Support Scheme?

Housing type
metadata.content: You live in a 1- to 5-room HDB flat. You or your spouse do not own a 5-room or larger HDB flat, private property or multiple properties.

content: You live in a household with a monthly income per person of up to $1,800.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Who’s eligible for the Silver Support Scheme?

Low household income
metadata.content: You live in a household with a monthly income per person of up to $1,800.

content: If you are eligible, you will receive a notification letter in December each year and will automatically receive payments every subsequent quarter. The amount you will receive depends on your household monthly income per person and the type of HDB flat you live in. If you are a Singapore Citizen aged 65 and above, and receiving ComCare Long-Term Assistance (LTA), you will receive $360 per quarter regardless of flat type and household monthly income.

metadata.content: If you are eligible, you will receive a notification letter in December each year and will automatically receive payments every subsequent quarter. The amount you will receive depends on your household monthly income per person and the type of HDB flat you live in. If you are a Singapore Citizen aged 65 and above, and receiving ComCare Long-Term Assistance (LTA), you will receive $360 per quarter regardless of flat type and household monthly income.

content: The rental rates for different HDB flat types are determined by the household monthly income per person. For 1- and 2-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $900 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $450 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 3-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $720 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $360 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 4-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $540 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $270 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 5-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $360 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $180 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Your Silver Support benefits per quarter

By household monthly income
metadata.content: The rental rates for different HDB flat types are determined by the household monthly income per person. For 1- and 2-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $900 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $450 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 3-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $720 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $360 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 4-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $540 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $270 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person. For 5-room HDB flats, the monthly rental is $360 for households with income up to $1,300 per person and $180 for households with income between $1,300 and $1,800 per person.

content: You will start receiving payments in the quarter you turn age 65. You will receive your SS benefit in your PayNow bank account linked to your NRIC number, if you have one. Otherwise, your SS will be credited to your bank account which you have registered with the Government to receive Government payments (e.g. GST Voucher, Workfare). If you do not have a PayNow-NRIC-linked bank account or a bank account registered with the Government, you will receive your SS benefit by GovCash.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Silver Support is paid out every quarter

REPLACE
metadata.content: You will start receiving payments in the quarter you turn age 65. You will receive your SS benefit in your PayNow bank account linked to your NRIC number, if you have one. Otherwise, your SS will be credited to your bank account which you have registered with the Government to receive Government payments (e.g. GST Voucher, Workfare). If you do not have a PayNow-NRIC-linked bank account or a bank account registered with the Government, you will receive your SS benefit by GovCash.

content: The payment date and eligibility period for various periods are as follows: For the period from January to March, the payment date is 31 March, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of March. For the period from April to June, the payment date is 30 June, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of June. For the period from July to September, the payment date is 30 September, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of September. For the period from October to December, the payment date is 31 December, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of December.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Silver Support is paid out every quarter

PAYMENT SCHEDULE
metadata.content: The payment date and eligibility period for various periods are as follows: For the period from January to March, the payment date is 31 March, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of March. For the period from April to June, the payment date is 30 June, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of June. For the period from July to September, the payment date is 30 September, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of September. For the period from October to December, the payment date is 31 December, and the eligibility period is from 31 December of the preceding year to the end of December.

content: The permanent Silver Support (SS) Scheme is part of a wider suite of schemes (e.g. healthcare subsidies, GST voucher) that the Government has put in place to give seniors greater assurance in retirement. It provides a quarterly cash supplement to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have less in retirement. The Government reviews the Scheme periodically to ensure that it continues to target deserving seniors. Seniors who qualify for SS will automatically receive their cash supplement. There is no need to apply.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

What is the Silver Support Scheme?
metadata.content: The permanent Silver Support (SS) Scheme is part of a wider suite of schemes (e.g. healthcare subsidies, GST voucher) that the Government has put in place to give seniors greater assurance in retirement. It provides a quarterly cash supplement to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have less in retirement. The Government reviews the Scheme periodically to ensure that it continues to target deserving seniors. Seniors who qualify for SS will automatically receive their cash supplement. There is no need to apply.

content: The Silver Support (SS) Scheme is designed to provide support to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have limited financial resources in retirement. To qualify for the SS Scheme, Singapore citizens aged 65 and above must meet the following criteria: Low lifetime wages - Their total CPF contributions by age 55 should not exceed $140,000. Self-employed individuals should also have an average annual net trade income of no more than $27,600 when they were between the ages of 45 and 54. Housing type - They should live in a 1- to 5-room HDB flat and should not own, or have a spouse who owns, a 5-room or larger HDB flat, private property, or multiple properties. Low household support - They should live in a household with a monthly income per person of up to $1,800. The CPF Board will conduct an annual review of eligibility for SS, and eligible seniors will receive a notification in December of the preceding year. Seniors who qualify for SS will start receiving payments in the quarter they turn 65. Additionally, all Singaporeans aged 65 and above can check their SS eligibility by logging in to the SS e-Services using their Singpass credentials.

metadata.header:
Silver Support Scheme

Do I qualify for the Silver Support Scheme?
metadata.content: The Silver Support (SS) Scheme is designed to provide support to seniors who had low incomes during their working years and now have limited financial resources in retirement. To qualify for the SS Scheme, Singapore citizens aged 65 and above must meet the following criteria: Low lifetime wages - Their total CPF contributions by age 55 should not exceed $140,000. Self-employed individuals should also have an average annual net trade income of no more than $27,600 when they were between the ages of 45 and 54. Housing type - They should live in a 1- to 5-room HDB flat and should not own, or have a spouse who owns, a 5-room or larger HDB flat, private property, or multiple properties. Low household support - They should live in a household with a monthly income per person of up to $1,800. The CPF Board will conduct an annual review of eligibility for SS, and eligible seniors will receive a notification in December of the preceding year. Seniors who qualify for SS will start receiving payments in the quarter they turn 65. Additionally, all Singaporeans aged 65 and above can check their SS eligibility by logging in to the SS e-Services using their Singpass credentials.
